moves.1. d4 e6 2. c4 Bb4+ 3. Bd2 Bxd2+ 4. Nxd2: I was aiming for the center with my pawns.
moves.6... d6 7. Qc2 h6 8. Bd3: Aiming for the h7-spot with my battery of Queen and light-square Bishop.
moves.8... Nbd7 9. O-O-O: O-O-O. Long castling, my goal was a pawn storm against Blacks castled King, because of that plan it was necessary for me to castle long.
moves.9... Re8 10. e5: Pretty good move. Opens up the b1-h7 diagonal and also chasing away a defending piece from the King´s camp.
moves.10... dxe5 11. dxe5 Ng4 12. Bh7+: Looks like a meaningless check, but i had a plan with it.
moves.12... Kf8 13. Ne4: It seems at a first glance that Black can win a pawn here. But he can´t, will then lose his Queen.
moves.13... Qe7: Black is relocating his Queen to a safer spot, away from the open and potentially dangerous d-file.
moves.14. Qc3: Now the e5-pawn must be more protected.
moves.15... Nh6 16. Rdg1: I want to control the g-and h-files with my Rooks after opening up.
moves.17... Kg7 18. Bxg6: That Bishop became trapped. But if my assault against Black´s King will have progress I can live with it.
moves.18... fxg6 19. gxh5 Kh8 20. Rxg6: I got already three pawns for my Bishop and has opened up the g-file against Black`s King. Probably a good exchange.
moves.20... Qf8 21. Qe3 Nf5 22. Qg5 Re7 23. Rg: I´m increasing the pressure against Black´s King camp. No extremely hurry.
moves.23... Kh7 24. Nf6+ Nxf6 25. exf6: Black´s position are worsening for every move!
moves.26... Bd7 27. h6: Better to improve my position than take Black´s Rook.
